website_summaries.verdict: A sturdy introductory ski with subtle feature additions that make them a great choice for toddlers.
pros: Good sliding action that gets children used to the sensation of skiing
Bottom of skis have "scales" that prevent backward sliding
Can add "edgie wedgie" attachment (available separately) to help teach basic skills
cons: Kids ages 5 to 7 will be too old for these introductory skis
Not okay for ski lifts or downhill skiing as the bindings are not breakaway
Bindings loosen up very quickly and may be too big for smaller toddlers

customer_reviews.title: Fun little practice skis for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: These are great skis. What these skis are for: getting your toddler comfortable in the snow, and feeling included when Mommy and Daddy have their skis on. This is to set the appetite for real skiing down the road. I'm a bit surprised at reviews expecting these to be serious downhill skis. You probably aren't likely to find anything good at this price. These skis fit their purpose wonderfully for us: our 21-month-old son loved being able to put on his skis and stomp around on the snow for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Tom

customer_reviews.title: They work
customer_reviews.text: Rent a good set to see if your kid will like it, and don't let them struggle on these. It will make for a much more enjoyable experience for your little one and yourself. One day on these and our little girl didn't like it very much. We returned with a nice rental set and legit boots and she loved it and so did we.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Introduction to snow ski
customer_reviews.text: Bought for an introduction to snow with our 2 year old son. He wore them a few times w his snow boots, we helped him stay upright. They are kind of flimsie but interested to see how he does when he is 3 and more strong in his legs.
customer_reviews.author: Tri-Cities Stars

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner ski
customer_reviews.text: As long as you know what you are receiving, you will be happy with them. If you are expecting some big fancy carve down the hill ski, this isn't it. What it is, it basically a training ski that will probably be dinged up quickly along the way but will serve its purpose well.
customer_reviews.author: jones0308

customer_reviews.title: Better quality then I had expected
customer_reviews.text: Better quality then I had expected. They are not downhill skis but was able to get my 2 year old on a pair of skis. I like that you can just strap normal boots into them for a real young kid getting out for the first few times on little hills.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are perfect for my 2 1/2 year old - they give ...
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for my 2 1/2 year old - they give her a sense of what having 'boards' attached her feet feels like, and she loves sliding across the living room rug...so far, she hasn't been willing to try them in the snow...but baby steps, people!
customer_reviews.author: josh ercole

customer_reviews.title: Fun but don't hold up for the winter
customer_reviews.text: The buckle broke the second time we used them. I replaced the buckle on my own and the plastic piece that hold the boot in snapped in half. Not built for the cold at all! Plastic isn't good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for our nephew, they are just as we expected and happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Christin Juliet

customer_reviews.title: Great find.
customer_reviews.text: Great for the younger ones in your family. The 2-4 year olds loved them and even skied down the hills with parents help. Great for getting them used to being on skis, they even loved to wear them out in the yard.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: A good introduction for a small child to the sport of ...
customer_reviews.text: These are nicer than I expected. A good introduction for a small child to the sport of skiing without a huge investment.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy 13905

customer_reviews.title: Great for a beginner
customer_reviews.text: Great for a beginner. The best pet is you can use the snow boots you own with these. No need to rent expensive ones
customer_reviews.author: Laura S.

customer_reviews.title: Work for me
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my needs used as a prop with my handmade dolls seem well made and good priced
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect beginner kid ski
customer_reviews.text: Perfect ski for my 2-year-old to learn how to ski without having to wear ski boots! Easy to put on/off with regular winter boots.
customer_reviews.author: KateL

customer_reviews.title: good quality intro skis
customer_reviews.text: its is definitely a great intro for toddler to the skiing, skis hold well on boots and pretty sturdy overall
customer_reviews.author: Elina Fogelson

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: These skis are cheap and broke the first time we used them. Amazon would not return them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: More of a toy then actual skis.
customer_reviews.text: Skis don't hold kids in place like a pair of ski boots would so it makes the child's buckle at the ankles too much. More of a toy then actual skis to learn on.
customer_reviews.author: Luana M Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Love these.
customer_reviews.text: Just as described. A perfect beginner ski to practice ground work.
customer_reviews.author: John Jones

customer_reviews.title: Why did I wait until the end of winter?
customer_reviews.text: My 2-1/2 year old loves these. FAR cheaper than renting skis and perfectly appropriate for her level and age. She is scared of sledding and trudging through snow and ice but she loves scooting around on top.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Arrived a day late and the buckle broke on my very first attempt to put on my child,
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well. But if you’re looking for a more ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well. But if you’re looking for a more serious Ski set for your children, this is not the product.
customer_reviews.author: MARIO ALBERTO GARZA

customer_reviews.title: Not New
customer_reviews.text: Product was dented and peeling. Clearly used and resold. Really disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Been using these skis for two winters. Looking forward to one more season with them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: the perfect ski to introduce little ones to the sport
customer_reviews.text: Our 3yr old granddaughter has a blast on these; the perfect ski to introduce little ones to the sport.
customer_reviews.author: BJJACOB

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfectly good pair of kids' introductory / play skis. They seem sturdy enough.
customer_reviews.author: Theodore Orosz

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Grandson had so much fun learning to ski. We loved watching him in the snow.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Simply adorable skis for my soon-to-be 3 year old
customer_reviews.text: Simply adorable skis for my soon-to-be 3 year old. They are short enough that she can easily manage "walking" in them as she would rather do than skiing.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Danner

customer_reviews.title: 7/10 durability
customer_reviews.text: They are a great beginer ski. The holes are already there for a specific edgie wedgie which should be included in the cost. The one that I bought after the purchase of the skis does not require a hole in the tips. Kind of a waste of a hole. They do what I wan tohough and seem to be about a 7/10 for durability.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca B

customer_reviews.title: Good for 2 to 3 year old back yard skiing
customer_reviews.text: These are fine for the backyard and for really young kids. But there is absolutely no boot/binding support so the kids are like rags dolls trying to stand on these things unless on flat ground. If you're going lift service skiing , save your money and rent/lease real skis bindings instead.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Not a good substitute for real skis
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea of these skis, but to no fault of the manufacture, skis without hard boots just don’t work. My daughter had regular winter boots in the skis, but all that happened was she would lean back too far and end up sitting down. If you had hard ski boots, the boots prevent you from leaning backwards and thus allow you to ski standing up. I would save your money for a season rental or just bite the bullet for real skis and boots.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: For kids 3+
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you realize these are not for really tiny people. I got these for my son and they are about the right size for him to try but his little tiny feet won't fit. The bindings are too big for kids under 3.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: garbage
customer_reviews.text: This is just a very expensive toy. Kids can't slide on this. The straps will get lose constantly, making it hard to keep them on. Buy a real ski!
customer_reviews.author: FC

customer_reviews.title: great beginnings
customer_reviews.text: my 2 and 4 yr old granddaughters love these skiis; they are perfect for little neighborhood hills as they begin to learn to ski. I bought the skis with no poles as they are low to the ground anyway. great product
customer_reviews.author: diwalk

customer_reviews.title: These are not nearly as great as I expected them to be and not as ...
customer_reviews.text: These are not nearly as great as I expected them to be and not as sturdy as the white, longer skis from this brand. The bottoms have too much plastic and there is little to no edge. I would only recommend buying these at a much lower price. Another problem is that the straps to the skis get in the way of the child using them.
customer_reviews.author: Inference King

customer_reviews.title: good for what they are
customer_reviews.text: Good for very young, but they are plastic, so don't expect them to last forever.
customer_reviews.author: Mom

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: These work great for the beginner! My niece is almost 2 and love these!
customer_reviews.author: Candace Frantz

customer_reviews.title: Training skis good for practice.
customer_reviews.text: Granddaughter loves them. Not for skiing but for getting use to having boards on her feet.
customer_reviews.author: Steven W. Hendryx

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome starter skis!
customer_reviews.text: My son actually picked these out for his 2 year old daughter and he said they're great! He's an avid skier, so I trust him.
customer_reviews.author: Krisel T Andersen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my 2 and a half year old!
customer_reviews.text: Being a skier for thirty years these skis were exactly what I expected, awesome! They fit over my son's snow boots perfectly and have helped show him the fun of being on skis. They are kids skis so don't confuse them for anything other than plastic but that is all a kid needs to have a blast.
customer_reviews.author: A.J. Capistron

customer_reviews.title: Used and dirty
customer_reviews.text: The skis are perfect for the purpose. The problem is both the box and the skis appeared to be used. They were scratched and dirty. I cleaned them and tried some wax to get out the scuff marks. I intended to sends them back but my wife had already wrapped them for Christmas so I just said the hell with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Lucky Bums Kids Beginner Snow Skis, Multiple Colors
product_meta.description: The Lucky Bums Kids Beginner Snow Skis are the ideal introduction to skiing for those 4 and under. They have a rugged design including flexible bindings with attached straps to ensure a secure fit, and scales on the bottom of the skis for added traction. These 70 cm plastic skis enable kids to get used to wearing skis in the snow and become accustomed to the sliding sensation. The bindings allow for heel lift, making these skis with no metal edges the ideal first pair of skis for kids just learning to walk all the way up to 4 years old.
feature_bullets: IDEAL FOR BEGINNERS - Introductory set of skis for little learners age 4 and under.
RUGGED DESIGN - Includes flexible bindings that allow heel lift and accommodate most snow boots or shoes.
IMPROVED TRACTION - Include scales on the bottom of the ski to enable traction in the snow.
SAFE FOR YOUNG SKIERS - Plastic skis with no metal edges and round tips make these the ideal first pair of skis for kids.

SATISFACTION GUARANTEED - When you receive a Lucky Bums product, if you are not 100% satisfied with your purchase, let us know. We are here for our customers and will respond promptly and professionally in order to fix any problems you may have.
